p: The effect of the ethyl acetate fraction of the bark of Diospyros mespiliformis on some haematological parameters of Wistar rats after sub-chronic administration is shown on Table 2. There was a dose - dependent decrease in the WBC, lymphocytes, monocytes, and granulocytes levels, in rats treated with the bark ethyl acetate fraction of DM. Others, including RBC count and MCV, although had irregular patterns of increase and decrease These observations were not significant among various dose groups and even in comparison with the control group that were administered distilled water at 5 mL/kg.
